Oral history: Sharing stories and experiences verbally can help preserve memories of the past, as people can pass down their knowledge and experiences to younger generations.

Digital archives: With the rise of digital technology, many institutions and individuals are digitizing their collections of photographs and other materials, creating online archives that can be accessed and preserved for future generations.
Memory boxes: Creating a physical box filled with items that evoke memories of a person or event can serve as a tangible reminder of the past.
Virtual reality: By creating virtual reality experiences, people can recreate historical events or environments, allowing them to explore and learn about the past in a more immersive way.
Personal journals: Writing down memories and experiences in a journal can help people preserve their own personal history, which can be passed down to future generations.
